page.title: 04THE WOOLLEN INDUSTRY
page.content: At the beginning of the century the villages of Drefach and Velindre were noted throughout the country because of the woollen industry.There were twenty three factories dotted along the banks of the four streams-Arthen, Bran, Esgair, Bargod,-that flow nearby and nineteen weaving shops in the two villages.There were numerous men, women and children busy carding, weaving and spinning in their own homes. But the golden era of the industry came to an end after the First World War.But the tradition still lives in the district and three factories are still working-Dolwerdd, Dyffryn and Melin Teifi. The Museum of the Welsh Woollen Industry,which is a branch of the Welsh Industrial and Maritime Museum was recently opened at the Cambrian Mill building. Old machinery and documents are on display
